Header.title: MANGALASSERIL CONSTRUCTIONS
Header.paragraph: Building Excellence Since 2001. For over 24 years, Mangalasseril Constructions has been a trusted name in the construction industry, delivering high-quality, durable, and innovative solutions.

About.paragraph: With a wealth of experience and a skilled workforce, we specialize in civil engineering, commercial and residential buildings, sheet piling for underground work, excavation, interior designing, landscaping, and steel fabrication. We also have a branch in UAE—Bina Al Hader Technical Services—specializing in steel fabrication, civil works, and technical solutions, serving industrial, commercial, and government sectors. Our strong foundation is built on expertise, quality, and innovation, with successful projects across commercial, residential, and industrial sectors.
Why: 24+ Years of Experience in Construction & Engineering
Expert Team of Engineers, Architects, and Skilled Professionals
Commitment to Quality, Safety, and Timely Project Delivery
Why2: Expanding Across India & the Middle East
Expertise in Civil Engineering & Structural Works

Services.name: Civil Engineering & Structural Works
Services.text: Delivering structurally sound, durable, and high-quality construction for commercial, residential, and industrial projects.

Services.name: Commercial & Residential Buildings
Services.text: Constructing high-rise apartments, office complexes, shopping malls, and community developments that meet international standards.

Services.name: Sheet Piling & Underground Construction
Services.text: Specialists in foundation work, basements, and underground structures, ensuring stability and long-term durability.

Services.name: Steel Fabrication & Industrial Installations
Services.text: Providing custom steel structures, industrial fabrication, and heavy-duty frameworks for large-scale projects.

Services.name: Interior Design & Landscaping
Services.text: Creating functional, visually stunning interiors and enhancing outdoor spaces with sustainable designs.
